prompt.content: How did Meta finance its "Hyperion" Louisiana data center?

rubrics.name: States that Meta financed the Hyperion Louisiana data center through a joint venture SPV with funds managed by Blue Owl Capital.

messages.content: States that Meta financed the Hyperion Louisiana data center through a joint venture SPV with funds managed by Blue Owl Capital.

rubrics.name: States that investment bank Morgan Stanley assisted Meta in arranging the financing.

messages.content: States that investment bank Morgan Stanley assisted Meta in arranging the financing.

rubrics.name: States that the structure supports about $27 billion of development costs.

messages.content: States that the structure supports about $27 billion of development costs.

rubrics.name: States that the SPV capital structure includes more than $27 billion of privately placed project bonds.

messages.content: States that the SPV capital structure includes more than $27 billion of privately placed project bonds.

rubrics.name: States that SPV equity is approximately $2.5 billion.

messages.content: States that SPV equity is approximately $2.5 billion.

rubrics.name: States that the equity ownership split is 80 percent for Blue Owl and 20 percent for Meta.

messages.content: States that the equity ownership split is 80 percent for Blue Owl and 20 percent for Meta.

rubrics.name: States that PIMCO is the anchor investor in the bond financing.

messages.content: States that PIMCO is the anchor investor in the bond financing.

rubrics.name: PIMCO is the anchor lender for the debt financing

messages.content: PIMCO is the anchor lender for the debt financing

rubrics.name: States that Meta will operate and lease back the campus under long-term operating leases.

messages.content: States that Meta will operate and lease back the campus under long-term operating leases.

rubrics.name: States that the project debt remains at the joint venture level.

messages.content: States that the project debt remains at the joint venture level.
